alert.note: Alert for Central Tangipahoa; Northern St. Tammany; Northern Tangipahoa; St. Helena; Washington (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 17 at 11:28PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern St. Helena, northwestern St. Tammany, central Tangipahoa and southwestern Washington Parishes through 1215 AM CDT... At 1128 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Greensburg, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Greensburg, Amite, Amite City, Independence, Roseland, Folsom and Montpelier. This includes Interstate 55 in Louisiana between mile markers 41 and 52. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for southeastern Louisiana.

area.areaDesc: Central Tangipahoa; Northern St. Tammany; Northern Tangipahoa; St. Helena; Washington
